decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: YD23-M14-P3-A100; YD23-M14-P3-A101; YD23-M14-P3-A200; YD23-M14-P3-A201; YD23-M14-P3-A202; Site Location Plan

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - INCIDENTAL USE - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes incidental (office/ summer house) to the residential use of the dwelling known as 14 Barnard Road, Mitcham Surrey, CR4 2LB

Condition : 6 - Removal of PD (Boundary Fence/Forms of enclosure) - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no boundary fence or any forms of enclosure in the rear garden shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - Removal of PD (Extensions/Alterations) - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the dwellinghouse other than that expressly authorised by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE:
This planning permission contains restrictive conditions that state 'the proposal shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposess incidental' . As a result, the outbuilding must remain with incidental use and cannot be used as living/sleeping quaters unless approved in writing by the council. Any use other than incidental will make the development unauthorised and possibly subject to enforcement action

Condition : 10 - The applicant is informed that this permission relates to an outbuilding forming anicallary accommodation to the main dwellinghouse ONLY.  

This does not allow the outbuilding to be let or occupied as a self contained dwellig unit.
description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING IN REAR GARDEN AS ANCILLARY ACCOMMODATION ONLY
